title: Operations Analyst
description: Operations Analyst New York City • Remote Clinical Remote • Remote Full-time About Fabric Health At Fabric Health, we're not just building technology; we're fixing healthcare's capacity problem. Our mission is to power healthcare to move faster, work smarter, and deliver better care, creating seamless, intuitive experiences that simplify and unify virtual and in-person care for thousands of providers and millions of patients nationwide. We're a team of brilliant, thoughtful minds, deeply motivated by improving patient and provider lives, and we believe technology can truly enhance the US healthcare system. Trusted by leading healthcare organizations: Our customers include Luminis Health, OSF HealthCare, MUSC Health, and Intermountain. We are backed by leading investors such as Thrive Capital, GV (Google Ventures), General Catalyst, Salesforce Ventures, Vast Ventures, BoxGroup, and Atento Capital. We value working quickly for good reason, listening deeply to solve big challenges, and building products like we would for loved ones. About the Role In this role, you will be a key player in supporting and growing our Virtual Care clinician network. As the primary point of contact for clinicians, you'll oversee onboarding, training, and day-to-day operations to ensure a seamless experience. You will be instrumental in driving clinician engagement, retention, and overall network success. This position is ideal for someone passionate about enhancing clinician and patient experiences, as you will independently manage tasks, resolve issues, and support the design necessary to scale our provider network. What You'll Do As an Operations Analyst, you will be the core support resource for the clinician network. Your primary responsibilities will include: Clinician Relationship Management: Welcome, onboard, and maintain a positive relationship with new clinicians, serving as their primary point of contact for day-to-day operational support. Operational Support: Independently prioritize, resolve, or escalate clinician and patient issues as they arise, and research complaints to determine root causes and implement remedies. Network Growth & Scale: Support the design and implementation of operations necessary to increase the scale of the provider network and maximize clinician engagement, satisfaction, and retention. Data & Analysis: Use data from multiple sources to develop reports and perform ad-hoc analysis to support business initiatives. Workflow Management: Gain an understanding of all clinical service lines, general telehealth operations, provider contractual obligations, and workflows. Administration & Maintenance: Ensure clinician schedules are accurately maintained and manage clinician profiles and related account information. Why You Might Be a Good Fit You are passionate about enhancing clinician and patient experiences through operational excellence and support. You are an excellent communicator, capable of effectively working with cross-functional teams and building lasting relationships. You thrive in a role that requires a balance of daily operational troubleshooting and long-term project work aimed at increasing network scale. You possess excellent problem-solving abilities and demonstrate initiative, capable of identifying problems and implementing solutions independently. You are highly organized and can analyze and present complex data in a clear, concise, and easy-to-interpret manner. This Might Not Be The Right Fit If... You prefer a role that is purely technical and does not involve daily, direct operational support and relationship management with clinicians. You are not comfortable working independently, prioritizing escalated issues, and managing tasks without close supervision. You lack the organizational discipline required to maintain accurate data (schedules, profiles) and documentation. You are not motivated by the challenge of using data and analysis to drive the scale and efficiency of a provider network. Your Qualifications Bachelor's degree OR 4 years experience in healthcare operations, provider operations, program support, relationship management, or a similar role. Excellent ability to communicate effectively and work with cross-functional teams. Ability to work independently and demonstrate initiative in identifying problems and implementing solutions. Excellent time management skills to balance daily escalated issues with long-term project work. Ability to analyze and present data in a clear, concise, and easy-to-interpret manner. Proficiency with Google Apps G Suite or Microsoft Office. Ability to learn a variety of new software applications necessary for operations. Bonus Points Experience working directly with clinicians. Experience with virtual care programs. The national pay range for this role is $50,000.00 – $80,000.00 per year. Actual compensation will be determined by factors such as the candidate's geographic market, experience, skills, and qualifications. Certain roles may also be eligible for additional compensation, including a comprehensive benefits package such as medical, dental, vision, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan, stock options and bonuses. If your compensation requirement is greater than our posted range, please still consider applying; a determination can be made based on unique qualifications. Expected compensation ranges for this role may change over time. Note: Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for current or future visa sponsorship. Learn more about Fabric LinkedIn Awards Press Releases Careers Page At Fabric, we believe that a diverse workforce is essential to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. We actively encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply. Ready to apply? description: Overview: Alera Group is looking for a Sales Analyst. title: Project Assistant, Box PIMS-988/51512
description: The duties that the incumbent of the vacancy will be expected to perform. Duties Description The New York State Education Department's (NYSED) Office of Management Services is seeking candidates for a Project Assistant position in the Office of Information Technology Services. This Office is responsible for implementing and maintaining technology infrastructure supporting NYSED Program Office operations. Duties of this position include, but are not limited to, the following: • Help with implementation activities to create the planning documents and design models for the Office of the Professions' Modernization Program.• Gather critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and produce useful reports, as needed;• Conduct meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings;• Perform requirements analysis;• Document and communicate the results of the project team's efforts;• Perform user acceptance testing;• Update, implement, and maintain program procedures;• Serve as a liaison between stakeholders and users;• Coordinate stakeholder input and feedback;• Report and monitor the resolution of any issues that stakeholders may experience during the transition; and,• Provide instructional assistance and support, over the phone, via webinar, or in person, regarding program-specific processes and procedures in a "how to" manner. " The minimum qualifications required for this vacancy. Minimum Qualifications MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Candidates must have a minimum of six years of general work experience in customer service, training, or communications. Two years of this experience must have been conducted business analysis or experience with the New York State licensing processes and procedures. An associate's degree may substitute for two years of the required experience. A bachelor's degree may substitute for four years of the required experience. It is essential that candidates clearly and concisely indicate exactly how they meet the above minimum qualifications in their resume. Failure to show how you meet the minimum qualifications above may result in disqualification and removal from consideration. Additional comments regarding the vacancy. Additional Comments CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT: This will be a temporary appointment. Promotions and transfers may change appointees' negotiating unit. Candidates should be aware that changes in negotiating units may affect their salary, insurance, and other benefits. Verification of experience and or/degree will be required at the time of interview for all candidates. This position allows for the opportunity to telecommute up to 30% each bi-weekly pay period and is granted at the discretion of the supervisor and the appointing office. Federal law may impose additional requirements or restrictions regarding positions that receive federal funding.This position leads to a maximum salary of $85,138 based on annual performance advances. For new State employees appointed to graded positions, the annual salary is the hiring rate (beginning of the Salary Range) of the position. Promotion salaries are calculated by the NYS Office of the State Comptroller in accordance with NYS Civil Service Law, OSC Payroll rules and regulations and negotiated union contracts.Based on this position's location, in addition to the listed base salary, this position also receives a $4,000 downstate adjustment. APPLICATION: Qualified candidates should send a resume and letter of interest by December 3 2025 to OMSJOBS@NYSED.GOV (email submissions are preferred). Your resume must clearly indicate how you meet the minimum qualifications for this position. You must include the Box number (PIMS-988/51512) of the position in the subject line of your email and cover letter to ensure receipt of your application. Links to application materials will not be accepted (i.e., Google Docs). Your social security number may be required to confirm your eligibility.New York State Education Department (NYSED) is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. NYS Human Rights Law prohibits discrimination because of age, race, creed, color, national origin, sexual orientation, military status, sex, disability, predisposing genetic characteristics, marital status, domestic violence victim status, gender identity, prior conviction records, prior arrests, youthful offender adjudications, or sealed records. Interested in a job with New York State, but don't know where to start? Visit these links for information on working for New York State: • https://www.cs.ny.gov/jobseeker/ • https://www.cs.ny.gov/pio/publications/gettingajob.pdfGenerous benefits of working for New York State, including, but not limited to, the following: Holiday & Paid Time Off• Thirteen (13) paid holidays annually.• Thirteen (13) days of paid vacation leave in year one, increasing to 20+ days with additional years of service. • Five (5) days of paid personal leave annually.• Thirteen (13) days of paid sick leave annually for PEF/CSEA and eight (8) days paid sick leave annually for M/C. • Annual professional leave and educational leave opportunities for eligible staff.Health Care Benefits• Eligible employees and dependents can choose from a variety of affordable and generous health insurance programs.• Family dental and vision benefits at no additional cost.Additional Benefits• Enrollment in the New York State pension system which has earned the distinction of being one of the best-managed and best-funded plans in the nation OR Optional Retirement Defined Contribution Plan with 8% salary match (eligibility requirements apply).• NYS Deferred Compensation and an exclusive 403(b) Optional Retirement Savings Plan.• Paid Parental Leave for all employees and Paid Family Leave (M/C Only). • Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF).• Eligibility for various life insurance options. Some positions may require additional credentials or a background check to verify your identity.

Acts as lead Business Systems Analyst on team; coordinates exchanges of knowledge and ideas, and mentors business systems analysts in all phases of the project lifecycle to ensure that best practices and standards are followed. Collaborates with Business Unit and/or Project Manager on assigned projects. Works under general supervision. What We Provide Referral bonus opportunities Generous paid time off (PTO), starting at 30 days of paid time off and 9 company holidays Health insurance plan for you and your loved ones, Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability Employer-matched retirement saving funds Personal and financial wellness programs Pre-tax flexible spending accounts (FSAs) for healthcare and dependent care Generous tuition reimbursement for qualifying degrees Opportunities for professional growth and career advancement Internal mobility, generous tuition reimbursement, CEU credits, and advancement opportunities What You Will Do Serves as primary technical expert and principal designer of information systems for the managed healthcare business. Collaborates with senior level management to understand business needs and challenges, and to develop, design, plan, and deliver information systems solutions to meet managed care payor needs. Functions as lead Business Systems Analyst on team. Works independently on most deliverables. Works in partnership with senior leadership and training department to ensure successful delivery of project objectives. Develops business case and ROI models to support user requests, coordinates with business leadership, finance and IT leadership as necessary. Performs high level product research relating to build/buy decisions. Gathers requirements from cross-organizational groups, including policy makers, leadership, business, clinical and IT staff for new development and/or enhancements of Clinical System and related applications. Includes participation in a build/buy analysis and gathering requirements for a vendor application selection. Analyzes requirements, workflow and consequences of system changes, and recommends changes to address deficiencies. Develops design for new and/or enhanced systems for all platforms (Tablet, Mainframe, Web). Writes requirements, functional specifications, report or metrics specifications, and other supporting documentation for new and/or enhanced systems. Produces documentation suitable for business clients, programmers, QA and trainers. Ensures that new or enhanced aspects of clinical systems are in compliance with state and federal regulations. Informs department manager and project manager of project progress and problems, and ensures that these problems are reviewed and resolved prior to implementation. Participates in all phases of the project lifecycle and ensures that standards are followed and the systems developed or modified are adequately tested or documented. Advises on testing procedures and documentation, training methods and curriculum, implementation and conversion planning. Participates in standardizing formats and methodologies for requirements, functional specifications and system documentation. Monitors developments in the industry and helps bring best practices to the department. May mentor and coach less experienced Business Systems Analyst staff; coordinates exchange of knowledge, ideas and methods, and iRise best practice; advises analysts on developing specifications to ensure completeness and accuracy. Models existing undocumented systems; works with analyst team to build library of documentation and makes it available to the team. Teaches modeling methods and helps advance the knowledge and expertise of the group. May perform other leadership roles including team building, staff training specific to business analysis, on boarding and support of new hires. Coordinates with Operations Team in the development of educational training materials, user procedure manuals and user testing. Prepares reports on pre-test and post-test results to address deficiencies and educates team members and trainers on content. Maintains analysts' library of resources. Develops library of pertinent books and articles on information systems for the department. Develops and distributes regular management reports and any requests for special, ad hoc reporting or claims data. Develops positive working relationships with VNS Health Plans leadership. Develops an understanding of VNS Health Plans strategic business objectives and business unit operations, along a particular health plan value stream. Articulates business issues and designs data collection methodologies. Provides data collection and analytical support to team and monitors projects led by Service Operations team. Summarizes, creates, and distributes reports as needed. Visualizes data in creative ways to enhance understanding and accelerate decision making. Assists in writing reports, memos and other communications as needed. Coordinates report production as needed. Creates and implements dashboards with key performance indicators and forecasting models. Participates in interdepartmental work groups in support of process improvement projects, as needed. Assists in the design and delivery of presentations on project status and outcomes to management. Monitors new and existing process designs to measure operational effectiveness. Provides financial impact analysis for all retro compensation grids as a result of amendments or new published state rates. Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned. Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Computer Science, MIS, Information Technology, or Communications Engineering or equivalent experience required Work Experience: Minimum five years experience with responsibility for end-to-end SDLC design, development and implementation of managed healthcare payor solutions, (or two years of this experience plus a Master's Degree in one of the above-required fields) required At least one year of experience must be with a managed care organization on business transformation required All candidates must have two years experience using FACETS, SQL scripts & queries, OBIEE, Power BI, Tableau & MicroStrategy reports & dashboards; project management & SDLC methodologies, with contracting and new business management across relational databases, using Oracle, SQL Server & DB2, managing stakeholder expectations and providing HIPAA-compliant guidance to business partners, vendors, and end-users, per industry standards for EDI protocols. Strong command of Microsoft Office Tools (Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint) required, and mobile computing platforms & web- based technologies required Effective oral and written communication skills, consulting and analytical skills and ability to work with clients, IT management, staff, consultants and vendors required Ability to function autonomously, and collaborate with most senior level leaders across the agency required Claims Only: Minimum one year work experience in consulting, operations or financial analysis, Claims analytics or related discipline required Proficient with personal computers, including Microsoft Windows Excel, Word, Access, Power Point, Facets and (Altruista) Guiding care required Demonstrated understanding of NYS, CMS and Medicaid reimbursement guidelines. APG, APC, DRG preferred Pay Range USD $93,400.00 - USD $116,800.00 /Yr. About Us VNS Health is one of the nation's largest nonprofit home and community-based health care organizations. Innovating in health care for more than 130 years, our commitment to health and well-being is what drives us — we help people live, age and heal where they feel most comfortable, in their own homes, connected to their family and community. On any given day, more than 10,000 VNS Health team members deliver compassionate care, unparalleled expertise and 24/7 solutions and resources to the more than 43,000 "neighbors" who look to us for care. Powered and informed by data analytics that are unmatched in the home and community-health industry, VNS Health offers a full range of health care services, solutions and health plans designed to simplify the health care experience and meet the diverse and complex needs of the communities and people we serve in New York and beyond.

title: Senior Business Analyst, Inves Tech
description: About Invesco As one of the world's leading independent global investment firms, Invesco is dedicated to rethinking possibilities for our clients. By delivering the combined power of our distinctive investment management capabilities, we provide a wide range of investment strategies and vehicles to our clients around the world. If you're looking for challenging work, intelligent colleagues, and exposure across a global footprint, come explore your potential at Invesco. What's in it for you? Our people are at the very core of our success. Invesco employees get more out of life through our comprehensive compensation and benefit offerings including: Flexible paid time off Hybrid work schedule 401(K) matching of 100% up to the first 6% with a discretionary supplemental contribution Health & wellbeing benefits Parental Leave benefits Employee stock purchase plan Job Description Your Role This role will involve both business analysis and project management aspects, collaborating with multiple Front Office and Technology teams to address business problems and identify Technology solutions. You will be a key contributor to ongoing critical Front Office Technology solutions, and will play a vital role in the Investment Technology delivery of our Strategic Imperatives. You will work collaboratively and directly with other engineering teams and analysts to build robust, high-quality systems using modern software engineering techniques. The ideal candidate is always seeking to understand not just the 'what' of an issue, but also the 'why', and able to articulate the optionality around potential solutions clearly to colleagues and partners. You should be as comfortable speaking with Investment Professionals about the innovations they seek as with Technology colleagues You will be responsible for: Consulting with Business Partners in the Front Office to solicit in-depth requirements that contribute to the design, build and implementation of solutions and enhancements Partnering with other Investment related teams – i.e. Capital Markets, Investment Compliance, Investment Services – as well as external vendors in the execution of project delivery Playing a implementation role in the development roadmap of new and existing tools and to continuously refine and improve the level of capabilities delivered Developing subject matter expertise in the core business processes under review in order to propose the most optimal solutions Challenging yourself and our business partners to think to the future, asking can things be done differently ? Project managing certain initiatives, including the provision of delivery status updates and the management of risks and issues Providing consultative assistance to the Engineering Run/Support teams on an ad-hoc basis Actively participating in Agile squad ceremonies, working with the Scrum Master and Product Owners to ensure backlog prioritization is correctly focused The experience you Bring: Ideally 5+ years experience in Asset Management ideally, or Investment Banking as an alternative Exposure to equity, fixed income and derivative instruments You will ideally have a good understanding of the function of Order Management Systems, preferably with Charles River or a comparable platform Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Proficient at engaging with partners and colleagues to understand and effectively document problem statements Able to understand a problem end to end, challenging the continuation of legacy processes when appropriate Strong written and verbal communication skills and be comfortable compiling and delivering presentations and solution design documents Familiar with Agile practices and methodologies Comfortable partnering with partner BA's and Engineers to derive suitable solutions for business problems Passionate about technologies, continually learning and refining your craft; have an appetite of taking on challenges and using new technologies Possess strong SQL skills around database interrogation together with an understanding of Oracle PLSql The salary range for this position is $80,000 - $103,000/ year. The total compensation offered for this position includes salary and incentive pay and will vary based on skills, experience and location. Full Time / Part Time Full time Worker Type Employee Job Exempt (Yes / No) Yes Workplace Model Pursuant to Invesco's Workplace Policy, employees are expected to comply with the firm's most current workplace model, which as of October 1, 2025, includes spending at least four full days each week working in an Invesco office. This reflects our belief that spending time together in the office helps us build stronger relationships, collaborate more easily, and support each other's growth and development. The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The job holder may be required to perform other duties as deemed appropriate by their manager from time to time. Invesco's culture of inclusivity and its commitment to diversity in the workplace are demonstrated through our people practices. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, age, or veteran status. Our equal opportunity employment efforts comply with all applicable U.S. state and federal laws governing non-discrimination in employment.

title: Business Analyst
description: Business Analyst New York City • Remote Clinical Remote • Remote Full-time About Fabric Health At Fabric Health, we're not just building technology; we're fixing healthcare's capacity problem. Our mission is to power healthcare to move faster, work smarter, and deliver better care, creating seamless, intuitive experiences that simplify and unify virtual and in-person care for thousands of providers and millions of patients nationwide. We're a team of brilliant, thoughtful minds, deeply motivated by improving patient and provider lives, and we believe technology can truly enhance the US healthcare system. Trusted by leading healthcare organizations: Our customers include Luminis Health, OSF HealthCare, MUSC Health, and Intermountain. We are backed by leading investors such as Thrive Capital, GV (Google Ventures), General Catalyst, Salesforce Ventures, Vast Ventures, BoxGroup, and Atento Capital. We value working quickly for good reason, listening deeply to solve big challenges, and building products like we would for loved ones. About the Role In this role, you'll be a key player in ensuring the efficient and strategic delivery of clinical operations. The role involves driving detailed process analysis and optimization initiatives within Clinical Operations and managing a diverse portfolio of projects. You will also play a key part in supporting the planning for new service, growth, and expansion initiatives across the organization by providing crucial data insights and financial models. This position requires strong analytical depth, project management skills, and the ability to work independently to solve complex operational challenges. What You'll Do As a Business Analyst, you will lead strategic initiatives across data, compliance, and process optimization. Your primary responsibilities will include: Data, Reporting, and Strategy: Conduct focused data analysis and reporting on clinical outcomes. Lead routine monitoring of key healthcare metrics (including NPS, patient satisfaction, and quality measures), and develop financial models for service pricing and clinician compensation. Project Management & Compliance: Serve as a dedicated Project Manager for the Clinical Operations portfolio. Manage essential support for Business Operations & Planning, and the administration of clinician contracts. Clinical Process Improvement: Lead process analysis and optimization initiatives to enhance efficiency, quality, and patient throughput. Manage vendor relationships critical to successful clinical delivery. Growth Support: Provide essential support for planning new service, growth, and expansion initiatives. Why You Might Be a Good Fit You possess excellent analytical skills and thrive on the challenge of translating complex data into clear, concise, and easy-to-interpret strategic reports. You are a self-starter who excels at working independently, demonstrating initiative in identifying problems and implementing solutions. You are highly organized and capable of managing a diverse portfolio of projects and balancing daily operational support with long-term strategic work. You have a foundational background in healthcare operations and are motivated to drive efficiency and quality improvements within a clinical setting. You are an excellent communicator, capable of working effectively with cross-functional teams to drive process change. This Might Not Be The Right Fit If... You are not comfortable with the level of ambiguity that comes with identifying problems and creating solutions independently. You lack experience with data analysis and routine monitoring of key operational or clinical healthcare metrics. You prefer a purely administrative role that does not include dedicated project management and process optimization responsibilities. You are not comfortable managing diverse responsibilities across data analysis, compliance, and strategic planning. Your Qualifications Bachelor's degree OR 4 years experience in healthcare operations, provider operations, program support, relationship management, or a similar role. Excellent ability to communicate effectively and work with cross-functional teams. Ability to work independently and demonstrate initiative in identifying problems and implementing solutions. Excellent time management skills to balance daily escalated issues with long-term project work. Ability to analyze and present data in a clear, concise, and easy-to-interpret manner. Proficiency with Google Apps G Suite or Microsoft Office. Ability to learn a variety of new software applications necessary for operations. Bonus Points An understanding of multiple telehealth clinical service lines, general telehealth operations, provider contractual obligations, and workflows. Experience with data visualization tools (Thoughtspot, PowerBI, Tableau etc.). The national pay range for this role is $50,000.00 – $80,000.00 per year. Actual compensation will be determined by factors such as the candidate's geographic market, experience, skills, and qualifications. Certain roles may also be eligible for additional compensation, including a comprehensive benefits package such as medical, dental, vision, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan, stock options and bonuses. If your compensation requirement is greater than our posted range, please still consider applying; a determination can be made based on unique qualifications. Expected compensation ranges for this role may change over time. Note: Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for current or future visa sponsorship. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. title: Transaction Operations Analyst (6 Month Temp)
description: The Base We are based at 7 Bryant Park in the heart of NYC. and we have everything we need to work flexibly. We operate a hybrid working model, with a requirement that this Transaction Operations Analyst be in the office 3 days per week. This is to sustain our culture of innovation, collaboration, knowledge sharing, and building relationships within the business. The Team/Position Overview: This position is Temporary (6 Months) - Trade Operations Subject Matter Experts within the trade operations team to support the Manager of the team in delivery of the team's responsibilities. Ensure that equity, fixed income, cash, FX, Repo and Unit Trust trades are confirmed on a timely basis, settlement instructions are sent accurately & timely, and settlement issues or fails are pro-actively dealt with and resolved. Additionally, handle the investigation and resolution of any interest claims that may arise. The role holder will thrive in a fast-paced environment with an emphasis on meeting tight deadlines. A strong interest in learning and harnessing technology will help you with your role in the organization. Key Responsibilities: Deliver accurate, timely, compliant and cost-effective trade, cash and derivative processing services. Ensure processes and procedures are in place to: Achieve timely confirmation of trades across equity, fixed income, cash, FX, Repo and Unit Trust trades and ensure timely issuance of settlement instructions and cash payments/receipts. Identify, record, investigate and resolve trades failing to achieve market settlement by contractual settlement date. Monitor trade affirmations to ensure they are completed within stated time frame. Timely update of cash flows, fees/expenses, trade related FXs and externally managed cash and security movements such as STIF movements, as well as instructing cash movements at custody. Responsible for loading CFD, OTC Options, Credit Default Swaps, Interest Rate Swaps, Total Return Swaps and Inflation Linked Swaps trades and checking against recaps on trade date. Perform function in line with established business controls. Provide administrative, transactional based support to others involved in the task of fund / portfolio management. Support external client queries and ensure that they are investigated and responded to within agreed timelines. Contribute independently to department and Company initiatives and projects. Escalate potential problems before they become a risk. Meet the needs of our business partners and internal clients. Meet all deadlines and ensure procedures and controls are fully implemented. Skills and Behaviors Required: Bachelor's Degree preferred Typically, would require 1-2 years' experience gained in a Trade Management function within a Financial Services Operational team supporting equity, fixed income, cash, FX and Unit Trust asset classes. Good operational knowledge of SWIFT messaging standards. Strong understanding of operational risks and control frameworks. Wider experience in Asset Management and understanding of the end-to-end asset lifecycle. Good at analysing and solving problems with a strong handle on operational risk. Effective in managing your own time with ability to prioritise tasks and delegate appropriately. Excellent communicator with strong interpersonal skills. A strong team player able to develop strong working relationships with global internal departments and external counterparties. Able to adapt to changes quickly. Discharge of responsibilities The role holder shall ensure that all their responsibilities are performed to the highest levels of integrity, quality and transparency and in a manner most likely to promote the success of the Schroders Group, taking into account the interests of key stakeholders including clients, employees, regulators, suppliers and society as a whole. In discharging their responsibilities, the individual shall establish appropriate oversight and control structures for all areas under their control where needed. Reporting Obligations In discharging their responsibilities, the role holder shall Ensure that the Transaction Services - Trade Operations - Manager is made aware of any issues which the Transaction Services - Trade Operations - Analyst deems material ADA Schroder Investment Management North America Inc. complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. EEO/Affirmative Action Schroder Investment Management North America Inc. is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, age, marital status, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, intellectual disability, mental disability or physical disability, including, but not limited to, blindness, or protected veteran status. ility, mental disability or physical disability, including, but not limited to, blindness, or protected veteran status.

title: Analyst, Revenue Operations & Sales Strategy
description: Captivate is the largest on-the-go news and entertainment network in North America, reaching influential audiences where they work and live. From the biggest stories to today's weather, traffic updates to building amenity announcements, we're the daily source of information that sparks conversation, piques curiosity and makes an impact. We reach millions through our network of video-first screens in premier office buildings and luxury residential real estate, fostering powerful connections between brands and decision-makers, properties and affluent consumers. Influence the Influential with Captivate .is the largest on-the-go news and entertainment network in North America, reaching influential audiences where they work and live. From the biggest stories to today's weather, traffic updates to building amenity announcements, we're the daily source of information that sparks conversation, piques curiosity and makes an impact. We reach millions through our network of video-first screens in premier office buildings and luxury residential real estate, fostering powerful connections between brands and decision-makers, properties and affluent consumers. Influence the Influential with Captivate . The Opportunity: Analyst, Revenue Operations & Sales Strategy Captivate is offering an exciting opportunity for a motivated, ambitious professional eager to accelerate their career in Revenue Operations and Sales Strategy. As a Revenue Operations & Sales Strategy Analyst, you'll play a pivotal role at the intersection of Advertising Sales, Real Estate Sales, and Finance. Driving clarity, efficiency, and insights that directly shape Captivate's revenue growth. This isn't just a reporting role, it's a chance to own systems, optimize processes, and influence strategy. You'll dive deep into Salesforce, Tableau, and financial data to ensure accurate forecasting, scalable workflows, and actionable insights for leadership. For someone who thrives on solving complex problems, building reliable frameworks, and uncovering opportunities through data, this is a hands-on role where your impact will be felt company wide. You'll gain exposure to senior leadership, collaborate across functions, and help shape Captivate's strategy. This role will report directly to the VP of Revenue Operations & Sales Strategy. What You'll Do: Pipeline & Forecasting Manage Salesforce dashboards, opportunity data integrity, and pipeline tracking across ADS and RES Support forecast accuracy by running pipeline weighting models, analyzing historical trends, and preparing weekly/monthly leadership updates Reporting & Analytics Own recurring reports and dashboards such & board deck inputs Provide ad-hoc analysis to Finance, Sales, and Leadership teams to support strategic decision-making Ensure reconciliation of revenue data across Salesforce, Tableau, Snowflake, and Finance systems Sales Strategy Support Contribute to annual planning cycles including TAM builds, quota setting, and territory assignments Run scenario models to test growth strategies, pricing approaches, and churn impacts Support revenue leadership with insights into market expansion and performance trends Operational Efficiency Lead initiatives to streamline deduplication, strengthen validation, and perform automation QA, resulting in reduced manual workload and greater operational efficiency Partner with Tech and Finance to maintain data consistency and a single source of truth across systems Document processes and standardize reporting definitions for cross-team alignment Other Responsibilities Include: Developing an understanding of Captivate's advertising industry and media ecosystem, including programmatic buying, direct sales, CPM/UTL, and emerging revenue models, to bring context and insights into reporting and strategy Becoming proficient in Captivate's sales and reporting systems (Salesforce, Tableau, Snowflake, NetSuite, Celigo) Actively supporting commission calculations, attainment, and incentive reporting Participating in strategic reviews, quarterly business updates, and leadership planning sessions Salary Range: $105,000 annually About You: You don't just use the tools; you take ownership of them. You value clean data, efficient workflows, and processes that operate seamlessly. From resolving sync issues to building decision driving dashboards, you approach each challenge with curiosity and accountability. You're the kind of person who sees every system and process as an opportunity to innovate, simplify, and scale. By taking pride in creating order from complexity, you become the go-to problem solver who empowers teams, drives smarter decisions, and unlocks growth across the organization. What You Bring: 3+ years of experience in Revenue Operations, Sales Strategy, or related analytical role Advanced Excel skills with proven ability to analyze large datasets, build revenue models, and automate reports Familiarity with Salesforce (required), Tableau, and Snowflake (preferred) Strong communication skills—able to distill complex data into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders Highly organized, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple competing priorities A proactive, problem-solving mindset with a passion for improving business performance Driven, inventive, and always learning—continuously looking for opportunities to raise the bar Why You Should Work for Captivate: At Captivate, we "Bring Life to Work" because we recognize the ever-evolving connection between work and life. Employees are invited to be their authentic selves, bring new ideas, and use each experience as an opportunity to learn and grow. We have a strong company culture that offers more than just benefits, leaving our employees with a strong bond with their team and beyond. Captivate also offers competitive benefits to all full-time employees, including: Comprehensive Health Coverage Company paid Life Insurance, Short-Term & Long-Term Disability Pre-Tax Spending Accounts for Healthcare, Dependent Care & Commuter Expenses 401(k) Retirement Savings with Employer Match Paid Family Leave & Parental Leave And more Our Commitment to Diversity: At Captivate, we celebrate and embrace a diverse team. We are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of experiences, backgrounds, and skills. We encourage individuals of all races, colors, religions, marital statuses, ages, gender identities, gender expressions, sexual orientations, non-disqualifying physical or mental disabilities, national origins, veteran statuses, and any other legally protected characteristics to apply. Captivate is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: CallMiner Speech Analyst
description: Thank you for considering Progyny! The CallMiner Speech Business Analyst is an integral part of the Progyny Operations/QA Team, your responsibilities include expert data/business analysis, peer coaching & training, Identifying, and defining objectives for projects, providing direction, platform expertise, best practices & process improvement identification. This role ensures our teams follow best practices by analyzing all data withing the CallMiner platform. You will also evaluate multi-channel data sets for actionable insights, presenting key findings to leadership, and providing ongoing thought leadership to stakeholders. The position requires a highly disciplined self-starter, who thrives on managing projects with conflicting priorities. A balance of technical and soft skills is essential. Interest in artificial intelligence, machine learning, data modeling, API extraction and SQL query is a plus. What you'll do… Thorough quality control & peer review of content; mentor network of power users by teaching advanced search techniques, creative business solutions & real-world application. Configure database for CallMiner User Interface including query building & tuning to evaluate and improve patterns of language for driving business insights. Automated scoring & topic identification analyzing recorded audio and email to uncover trends and opportunities. Morgan and Chase brands. title: Business Analyst
description: <Job Overview> We are seeking a dynamic and detail-oriented Business Analyst to join our innovative team. In this role, you will serve as a vital bridge between business needs and technical solutions, leveraging your analytical expertise to drive strategic initiatives and optimize operational processes. Your energetic approach will help translate complex data into actionable insights, empowering stakeholders to make informed decisions. This position offers an exciting opportunity to work across diverse projects, utilizing cutting-edge tools and methodologies to shape the future of our organization. <Duties> Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather, analyze, and document requirements for various projects and initiatives. Develop comprehensive business models, process flows, and data visualizations using tools like Visio, Power BI, Tableau, and Looker to facilitate clear communication of insights. Design and implement database structures and data integration workflows utilizing SQL Server, Oracle, Talend, and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data accuracy and accessibility. Conduct in-depth data analysis using R, Python, VBA, Bash (Unix shell), and other analytics tools to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for process improvements. Manage project lifecycles within Agile frameworks, coordinating tasks across teams while adhering to SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) best practices. Develop dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into key performance indicators (KPIs) using Power BI, Tableau, or Looker. Support database design efforts and optimize data storage solutions for scalability and efficiency. Facilitate communication between technical teams and business units to ensure project requirements are fully understood and met. Maintain comprehensive documentation of processes, workflows, and system configurations to support ongoing operations and future enhancements. Stay current on industry trends related to data analysis, analytics tools, and emerging technologies such as linked data concepts. <Experience> Proven experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar analytical role with a strong focus on data-driven decision-making. Demonstrated proficiency with SQL Server, Oracle databases, and ETL tools like Talend or similar platforms. Hands-on experience with analytics platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker for creating dashboards and visualizations. Strong knowledge of project management methodologies including Agile practices; familiarity with SDLC processes is highly desirable. Technical skills in programming languages such as R or Python for advanced data analysis tasks; VBA scripting experience is a plus. Experience designing databases or working with database design principles to ensure efficient data storage solutions. Ability to perform complex analysis using SQL queries combined with analytical tools to extract meaningful insights from large datasets. Familiarity with Unix shell scripting (Bash) for automation tasks related to data processing workflows. Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts into clear business language. Knowledge of linked data principles and how they can be applied within organizational data ecosystems is advantageous. Join us in this energetic environment where your analytical talents will fuel impactful projects! We value innovation, collaboration, and a proactive mindset—if you're passionate about transforming data into strategic assets while working on diverse initiatives across the organization, we want to hear from you! Pay: $85,279.70 - $102,702.42 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) 2% match 401(k) 3% Match 401(k) matching Visa sponsorship Work Location: In person

title: Senior Project Manager, Medical Management
description: At CVS Health, we're building a world of health around every consumer and surrounding ourselves with dedicated colleagues who are passionate about transforming health care. As the nation's leading health solutions company, we reach millions of Americans through our local presence, digital channels and more than 300,000 purpose-driven colleagues – caring for people where, when and how they choose in a way that is uniquely more connected, more convenient and more compassionate. And we do it all with heart, each and every day. Position Summary We are seeking an experienced and strategic Senior Project Manager to lead clinical-focused initiatives supporting our Medical Management team. This role goes beyond traditional project management—it requires a strong business mindset, analytical capabilities, and the ability to design and implement solutions that improve clinical operations and outcomes. The ideal candidate will be deeply integrated into the business, acting as a Project Manager, Business Analyst, and Product Owner. Key Responsibilities: Lead and manage complex, cross-functional clinical and medical management projects from initiation through execution and delivery. Serve as a strategic partner to the Medical Management team, deeply integrating into business operations to drive impactful outcomes. Act as both Project Manager and Business Analyst, analyzing business workflows, policies, and rules to design and implement effective solutions. Function as a Product Owner, translating business needs into actionable requirements and overseeing solution development. Collaborate closely with IT teams to manage technical project components, ensuring alignment between business goals and system capabilities. Develop and maintain detailed project documentation, including project plans, process flows, requirements, and status reports. Responsible for managing the budget and/or financial implications of more complex projects Utilize data analytics and reporting tools to identify trends, solve problems, and drive continuous process improvement. Communicate complex technical concepts in clear, business-friendly language to stakeholders, including account management and external partners. Ensure projects are delivered on time, within scope, and aligned with strategic objectives. Group facilitation/presentation influencing various internal (these may be cross-functional/segment) and external parties (e.g., vendor management) Identifies issues that may stall project and addresses them by either resolving the issue or creating an alternative solution Builds communication plans for implementation to ensure all impacted parties (upstream/downstream) are informed of next steps for completion Acts as an advocate for change; may require influencing others to see the value in project, including managing interpersonal sensitivities and articulating the strategic view to ensure project alignment Required Qualifications 5 years of proven experience leading clinical or medical management projects in a healthcare or managed care environment. Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis, reporting, and visualization tools (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau). Demonstrated ability to create and interpret process flows, business requirements, and technical documentation. Experience in business analysis, including gathering and translating requirements, stakeholder engagement, and workflow optimization. Familiarity with healthcare regulations, utilization management, case management, and general medical management programs. Excellent organizational skills with a keen attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities. Strong communication and interpersonal skills; able to build relationships across clinical, technical, and business teams. Technical acumen to collaborate effectively with IT teams on system implementations, integrations, and enhancements. Proven track record in meeting project milestones and negotiating for resources. Advanced user of PPT; Demonstrated ability to create executive summaries, presentation materials, other project artifacts. Education Bachelor's degree preferred in healthcare administration, business, or related field work experience, advanced degree or clinical background a plus Pay Range The typical pay range for this role is: $67,900.00 - $199,144.00 This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors. This position is eligible for a CVS Health bonus, commission or short-term incentive program in addition to the base pay range listed above. This position also includes an award target in the company's equity award program. Our people fuel our future. Our teams reflect the customers, patients, members and communities we serve and we are committed to fostering a workplace where every colleague feels valued and that they belong. Great benefits for great people We take pride in our comprehensive and competitive mix of pay and benefits – investing in the physical, emotional and financial wellness of our colleagues and their families to help them be the healthiest they can be. In addition to our competitive wages, our great benefits include: Affordable medical plan options, a 401(k) plan (including matching company contributions), and an employee stock purchase plan . No-cost programs for all colleagues including wellness screenings, tobacco cessation and weight management programs, confidential counseling and financial coaching. Benefit solutions that address the different needs and preferences of our colleagues including paid time off, flexible work schedules, family leave, dependent care resources, colleague assistance programs, tuition assistance, retiree medical access and many other benefits depending on eligibility. For more information, visit https://jobs.cvshealth.com/us/en/benefits We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 12/12/2025 Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state and local laws.

title: Business Intelligence & Analytics Manager
description: At Moody's, we unite the brightest minds to turn today's risks into tomorrow's opportunities. We do this by striving to create an inclusive environment where everyone feels welcome to be who they are—with the freedom to exchange ideas, think innovatively, and listen to each other and customers in meaningful ways. Moody's is transforming how the world sees risk. As a global leader in ratings and integrated risk assessment, we're advancing AI to move from insight to action—enabling intelligence that not only understands complexity but responds to it. We decode risk to unlock opportunity, helping our clients navigate uncertainty with clarity, speed, and confidence. If you are excited about this opportunity but do not meet every single requirement, please apply! You still may be a great fit for this role or other open roles. We are seeking candidates who model our values: invest in every relationship, lead with curiosity, champion diverse perspectives, turn inputs into actions, and uphold trust through integrity. Skills and Competencies Qualifications Required 5+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or related roles Proficiency in BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) and SQL Strong proficiency in Python for data analysis, modeling, and automation Experience with Databricks and Microsoft Fabric for data engineering and analytics Experience managing analytics projects and leading teams Proven ability to connect disparate data sources to create integrated analytics solutions Excellent problem-solving skills and a solution-oriented mindset Strong communication skills with the ability to present complex data to business stakeholders Preferred Familiarity with SaaS metrics, ARR pipeline analytics, and sales performance reporting Experience in data governance frameworks and best practices Key Competencies Strategic thinking with the ability to align analytics initiatives to business priorities. Strong problem-solving skills and analytical mindset. Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines. Collaborative approach with strong stakeholder management skills. Commitment to data integrity and continuous improvement. Basic understanding of artificial intelligence concepts, with curiosity and enthusiasm for learning how AI tools can be used to improve processes and drive efficiency. Interest in exploring AI systems and a willingness to develop awareness of responsible AI practices, including risk management and ethical use. Education Bachelor's degree in Business, Analytics, Data Science, Information Systems, or related field (Master's preferred) Responsibilities We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Business Intelligence & Analytics Manager to lead the development, implementation, and optimization of BI and analytics solutions that drive data-informed decision-making across the organization. This role will be responsible for managing the end-to-end analytics lifecycle — from data acquisition and governance to dashboard design, advanced analytics, and stakeholder engagement. The ideal candidate will combine strong technical skills with business acumen, enabling them to translate complex data into actionable insights for leadership and operational teams. Strategy & Leadership Develop and execute the organization's BI and analytics strategy, ensuring alignment with business goals. Partner with key stakeholders to identify analytics opportunities and prioritize initiatives. Data Engineering & Integration Develop robust data pipelines in Databricks and Fabric for ingestion, transformation, and analysis of SFDC and related datasets. Ensure data quality, consistency, and governance across financial analytics datasets. Automate recurring analytics processes to improve efficiency and scalability. Business Intelligence Development Design, build, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik. Develop KPIs, metrics, and scorecards to monitor business performance across functions. Implement self-service BI capabilities to empower business users. Advanced Analytics Conduct deep-dive analyses to uncover trends, patterns, and root causes of business performance issues. Utilize statistical methods and predictive modeling to forecast outcomes and support strategic planning. Support pipeline analytics, ARR reporting, customer segmentation, and other core business metrics. Stakeholder Engagement Serve as the primary liaison between analytics and business teams, translating requirements into technical solutions. Present insights and recommendations to executive leadership in a clear, concise manner. Collaborate with marketing, sales, finance, and operations to ensure analytics solutions meet cross-functional needs. Problem Solving & Solution Orientation Proactively identify gaps in data or analytics processes and propose innovative solutions. Troubleshoot data issues and work to resolve discrepancies in ARR and pipeline reporting. Continuously improve analytics methodologies to enhance decision-making capabilities. About the team Our Business Intelligence team is responsible for transforming data into value for the organization through reporting, modeling and thought leadership. By joining our team, you will be part of exciting work in New York Area. Running the largest, fastest-growing, and highest-performing network of public charter schools in New York City takes a village - families, children, teachers, staff and faculty, advocates, and supporters alike. Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, handle and prioritize simultaneous requests, and manage laterally and upwards. Demonstrated ability to identify the need for and create processes where none existed. Business Analysis Skills: Proficient in analyzing business processes and requirements, and translating them into technical solutions. Creative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills. Self Starter: Ability to work autonomously and in a self-directed manner with minimal supervision on both long and short term projects without hesitation to manage up to the Head of Enrollment when necessary. Ability to influence and drive outcomes among a diverse group of colleagues Mission Driven: Is committed to our dual mission of disrupting public education to provide greater access to high-quality education Traits: Demonstrated ability to identify and create processes where none existed Ability to work autonomously and in a self-directed manner with minimal supervision Data-oriented approach to business problem-solving Strong organizational and clerical skills Meticulous attention to detail Excellent written and verbal communication skills; strong presentation skills Capable of performing despite uncertainty Is committed to our dual mission of disrupting public education to provide greater access to high-quality education. Good understanding of business and technical requirements, design on a technical level, configure, implement and test strategies in the credit system analytics. Support will be provided to other areas of Credit Risk and customer database. This position requires someone who can build strong working relationships. Key Responsibilities: Manage a team of both offshore and onsite developers to focused on specialized credit risk application development Review and analyze business and operations workflows, decision processes, and business objectives Configure, test, audit, implement and monitor new and existing policy changes, data sources and strategies Develop, review, and update internal, external, and post-implementation documentation including process flows, procedures, system flows, and change logs ensuring through and accurate information Troubleshoot systems and integration issues working closely with the appropriate resources to resolve them Develop, implement and monitor appropriate controls to ensure defect free implementation of risk strategies including documentation, review and testing procedures Ensure that credit analytics systems are operating efficiently Ensure appropriate requirements and solutions are developed based on a solid understanding of the impacted systems and standards Qualifications: Recognized credit risk product lead with 10+ years of experience at a large financial institution. 5+ years of experience managing a team of credit risk technology team. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Finance, Risk Management, or related field; Master's degree or professional certification (e.g., CFA, FRM) preferred. Experience with programming languages (Python, Angular),Snowlfake , Azure cloud, SQL databases, and data visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau). Products: Counter party Credit Risk, Credit Default Swaps, Interest Rates Swaps,FX Derivatives, Prime Brokerage trading, Equity Derivatives, Equity portfolio swaps, Equity TRS, Commodity Swaps. The more asset classes they know the better but deeper knowledge is preferred so only a couple with deep knowledge is acceptable. Finance and Risk management: Positions calculations, valuations, data aggregation / manipulation, reporting Advanced knowledge of business analysis activities such as data analysis, process mapping, requirements elicitation, user story creation and testing Comfortable managing multiple, competing priorities and able to deliver results under pressure and tight deadlines Source to target event and data mappings Agile methodologies Ability to influence and lead positive change to business processes by creating and recommending actionable solutions that are aligned with business objectives Ability to collaborate, plan, facilitate, and participate in working sessions with internal and external stakeholders, leadership, IT, vendors and cross functional teams Ability to write and document business and functional requirements, test cases and test execution Creativity and the ability to reach insightful conclusions Ability to build cross-functional relationships and influence people Ability to communicate complex concepts and analyses in a clear and concise manner to all levels of an organization Functional and Technical Requirements Definition (and use of a requirements catalogue) Business architecture, business requirement documentation (BRD) Good communications skills, both, written and verbal Good interpersonal skills The expected base salary ranges from $160k-$200k. title: Junior Business Analyst
description: About Us: Headquartered in New York City with offices throughout the U.S. and in Vancouver, Canada, Hudson is a market-leading specialty insurer that offers a wide range of property and casualty insurance products to corporations, professional firms and individuals through retailers, whole-salers and program administrators. Hudson underwrites specialty primary and excess insurance on an admitted basis through Hud-son Insurance Company and on a non-admitted basis through, Hudson Excess Insurance Company. Hudson Insurance Company is admitted in all U.S. jurisdictions. Hudson has surplus lines eligibility in all U.S. jurisdictions through Hudson Excess Insurance Company. Collectively known as Hudson Insurance Group, its companies are rated A+ (Superior) by A.M. Best, Financial Size Category XV. Hudson Insurance Group is the U.S. Insurance Division of Odys-seyRe, a leading worldwide underwriter of reinsurance and specialty insurance and wholly-owned by Fairfax Financial Holdings Limited. Position Description: We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Junior Business Analyst to join our team. This position requires a detail-oriented individual who can bridge the gap between stakeholders and technical teams. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical abilities and demonstrate proficiency in writing user stories within Azure DevOps (ADO). The Business Analyst will gather, document, and effectively translate business requirements into technical specifications that drive development and operational efficiency. Skills, Knowledge and Abilities : Partner with the analytics and data teams to understand reporting needs and translate them into clear, actionable technical requirements. Collaborate closely with data developers to write user stories in ADO and perform testing upon delivery Ensure data accuracy and consistency across reports while advocating for efficient, scalable data processes. Manage and prioritize multiple concurrent projects, ensuring timely and high-quality deliverables. Act as a liaison between technical and non-technical teams to bridge communication and expectations. Proven ability to gather, document, and translate business requirements into technical specifications for development teams. Strong SQL skills and understanding of relational databases . Proficiency in Excel for data analysis and validation. Excellent communication and collaboration skills with both business stakeholders and technical teams. Experience working with large data sets. title: Analyst, Merchant Operations
description: Our values start with our people, join a team that values you! Bring your talents to Ross, our leading off-price retail chain with over 2,200 stores, and a strong track record of success and growth. Our focus has always been bringing our customers a constant stream of high-quality brands and on-trend merchandise at extraordinary savings. All while providing a fun and exciting treasure hunt experience. As part of our team, you will experience: Success. Our winning team pursues excellence while learning and evolving Career growth. We develop industry leading talent because Ross grows when our people grow Teamwork. We work together to solve the hard problems and find the right solution Our commitment to Diversity, Equality & Inclusion, and our community. We celebrate the backgrounds, identities, and ideas of those who work and shop with us because our differences make us stronger. We strive to be a positive force in our community. Our Corporate headquarters are in Dublin, CA, we have 3 buying offices in key markets in New York City, Los Angeles, and Boston, and 8 distribution centers nationwide. With 2023 revenues of $20.4 billion, we are a Fortune 500 company who is committed to providing an inclusive work environment with continuous learning opportunities and development for our teams. About this opportunity... The Analyst, Merchant Operations is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and presenting data-driven insights and recommendations to identify and drive business improvements. This position will execute and refine standard reporting processes while effectively communicating results and recommendations to management in both written and verbal formats. The Analyst must possess strong collaboration skills, working closely with cross-functional partners such as Distribution Centers, Planning, Merchandising, and Allocation teams. This role requires the ability to work independently, manage multiple deliverables, and maintain focus on priorities in a fast-paced and evolving environment. The ideal candidate will leverage strong technical and functional skills to respond to ad-hoc data requests and support continuous process improvement across the organization. The base salary range for this role is $65,200 - $75,000. The base salary range is dependent on factors including, but not limited to, experience, skills, qualifications, relevant education, certifications, seniority, and location. The range listed is just one component of the total compensation package for employees. Other rewards vary by position and location. What you will do and what you will learn... Utilize Excel and related analytical tools to generate reports and insights for all levels of the organization, based on project needs or ad hoc requests. Proactively, analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and root causes within merchant-driven processes, and summarize key findings into clear, actionable presentations for both executive and operational teams to drive improvement. Independently evaluate current processes to identify opportunities for efficiency and improvement, and develop and present recommendations to management for implementation. Communicate effectively across all levels of the organization, adapting messaging and presentation style to suit the audience and ensure understanding and alignment. Combine and compare data from multiple sources to identify relationships, validate accuracy, and draw insights that support achieving desired business results. Manage daily/weekly/monthly/ad hoc analysis delivering accurate and timely reporting. Maintain/update existing job aids. What you need to be successful... Bachelor's degree Strong excel and analytical skills Retail merchandising, planning, or reporting skills Business acumen - demonstrated understanding of quality standards relative to analysis of data and statistics in a retail environment. Clear and concise communication skills Impeccable attention to detail 1-2 years' experience in retail Perks and Benefits of joining our team... Our Associates are at the heart of everything we do and we're proud to offer a range of benefits that reflect how much we value their contributions. Here's a peek into what you can expect as an eligible Ross Associate: A broad range of affordable health insurance options & personal medical plan concierge 401(k) with employer match and Life insurance Ample PTO including accrued vacation, paid holidays, diversity day, summer Fridays and the ability to purchase additional vacation. Employee stock purchase plan Access to health and wellness benefits such as BetterHelp and Headspace Charitable donations matched by Ross Stores Foundation And more.... Benefits vary by level and position and are subject to change
